name: Uranus

major_features: Ice giant with no solid surface
Extreme axial tilt causing extreme seasons

moons.origin: Formed in circumplanetary disk; includes captured objects

fun_facts: Uranus rotates on its side with an axial tilt of about 98°.
It was the first planet discovered with a telescope.
Uranus has a faint ring system and many icy moons.
Seasons on Uranus last ~20 Earth years due to its tilt.
description_short: An ice giant with extreme axial tilt and faint rings.
description_long: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and an ice giant composed mainly of hydrogen, helium, and volatile ices. Its extreme axial tilt causes dramatic seasonal variations. Voyager 2 provided the only close-up observations to date, revealing a complex system of rings and moons. Uranus remains a target for future missions to study its interior, atmosphere, rings, and satellite ocean worlds.
